title: Newsletter on prioritization frameworks
intent_text: I want a simple prioritization method to decide what to read next based on my intent and time.
extracted_text: The newsletter proposes a relevance-first queue: prioritize items by alignment with your stated goal, then by the expected value-to-effort ratio. It suggests labeling content with action-oriented buckets: read next, worth it, if time, skip. The author recommends always showing 'why' (reasons) for each label to reduce second-guessing. It provides examples: if content contains step-by-step instructions, templates, or decision frameworks, it should rank higher.
